SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Board

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Board extends Object implements Serializable
Representation of the game board, one for each game. Also keeps track of the tiles in the bag for statistical accuracy.
See Also:

    • getBoardContent

    • shouldBeRefilled

      public boolean shouldBeRefilled()
      method that checks at the end of the current player turn if there are "legal" available moves for the next player
      Returns:
      a boolean representing whether the board should be refilled or not

    • refillBoard

      public void refillBoard(int numplayers)
      Refills the board with tiles from the bag when there are not enough on the board

    • pick

      public TileType pick(int x, int y, int constraint)
      Picks a tile from the board, updates the game state accordingly and returns the tile type
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the tile
      y - y coordinate of the tile
      constraint - maximum number of tiles that can be picked (based on free cells in a player's library)
      Returns:
      the type of the picked tile to be put in the player's pick buffer, null if the tile isn't pick-able

    • definePickable

      public void definePickable()
      At the beginning of a player's turn, the board state is updated to reflect which cells can be picked. Info on the game state is documented at TileState. This method defines which cells are considered pickable at the beginning of a player's turn. Cells can either be pickable or not-pickable, PICKABLE_NEXT is set by the pick method, after a player picks his first tile.

    • isTileUsable

      public static boolean isTileUsable(int x, int y, int numPlayers)
      Checks if a specific coordinate is a valid tile on the board for a specific number of players
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the tile
      y - y coordinate of the tile
      numPlayers - number of players in the game
      Returns:
      true if the tile is valid, false otherwise
